title: Unrestricted file upload when creating quotes allows for Stored XSS

profile.name: Visma Public
profile.about: Visma delivers software that simplifies and digitizes core business processes in the private and public sector.

weakness.name: Unrestricted Upload of File with Dangerous Type

summaries.content:
An attacker is able to bypass the restrictions which limit user uploads to .PDF only. Utilizing this exploit an attacker can upload malicious content to the web server.

First the system checks the MIME-Type, and if it fails too match Content-Type: application/pdf then the upload won't be processed. It then checks if the PDF Magic-Bytes are within the body of the multi-part data, however it does not check WHERE within the body the bytes.

Therefore if a user supplies a file that contains %PDF anywhere in the file the upload will be accepted.

I was able to upload a .html embedded with the PDF magic-bytes and an included JavaScript code to gain Stored XSS.
